messages.title: Sid Garg's Five Pledges
messages.content: 1. As a parliamentary candidate, I will not stand in any other constituency nor seek parliamentary employment if I lose. 2. I've initiated a scheme to record my parliamentary expenses in full and seek independent auditing. I pledge to publish them online for constituents. 3. I aim to publish all my expenses online so constituents can see them. 4. Will hold regular meetings with my constituents as I am accountable to you. 5. I will not use my parliamentary office for personal gain nor allow 'cash for access'.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour is fighting the Tories on higher education policy, which the Tories have let deteriorate on their watch.
Labour has a range of support mechanisms for small businesses which I have pushed for, such as a free small claims conciliation and arbitration service and an innovation seed fund.
Labour has a host of child care pledges, such as 25 hours free childcare per week and a wraparound child care guarantee.
Every community should have access to superfast broadband, and we will be investing Â£13 billion outside London.
Labour plans include new, additional funding to deal with the environment and flooding.

images.caption: Sid Garg for Uxbridge & South Ruislip
